intro: Enneadynamis polonorum, commonly known as the Polish nine-angled plant, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Poland. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its unique nine-angled stems. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, similar to other members of the Apiaceae family. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
